page.title: 07RYE HILL WATER TOWER
page.content: The water tower is located on the very top of Rye Hill.It is an important landmark visible for miles around. The water comes mostly from boreholes into the chalk rock beneath Harlow and needs little treatment. When full,the tower holds 2.25 million litres,fed to Harlow by gravity through underground mains. The tower is one of many owned by the Lea Valley Water Corporation and is the main source of domestic tap water throughout Harlow.As each person uses about 180 litres of water a day,the supply is very important.The waste water must be treated,and Harlow's water goes to Stanstead Abbotts for treatment before being returned to the River Lea.
